comment: Dr. Holdzkom was a good teacher. However, her attendance policy is awful. Every absence docks 3 points from your grade after a certain point. I had a long semester. My cat died. I had a car accident. Mentally things were bad. I had 7 absences from her class. None were forgiven, even after I begged for some sympathy. She is a stickler for the rules.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: 3 Tests. About 5 quizzes and 6 discussions. The discussions are group work with random people and it can be frustrating when people don't do their part. Tests are very easy just make sure the time lines are memorized and you really listen to what she says in lectures it verbatim what's on the exam! Also the final isn't cumulative
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects--Graded by few things

comment: My complaint has to do with the professor's condescending announcements and being unhelpful when you send her emails. Discussions/quizzes are easy but the exams are lockdown and webcam and require you to remember the timeline of all the events. If you have to take her you'll be fine but prepare for these exams.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Not too hard, but her videos are slow and boring. Some weeks have a quiz and group post, others have no assignment. Quizzes cover milestone documents (paid access required), but I didn't buy it and still got 100s (no lockdown browser iykwim). Exams use lockdown browser; knowing details about the timeline events she posts guarantees at least an 80.
rating_tags: Lecture heavy

comment: Wonderful, caring professor! She has lots of recorded lectures and you NEED to take notes. Also need to practice the timelines which are a big portion of the exams. It honestly was a very fun class and like I said as long as you take notes you will do well!
rating_tags: Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: It seems like all of her lectures were uploaded during covid and she is a very slow speaker. She also needs to work on being more concise and less condescending in emails/syllabi. Exams cover unreasonably specific details from her lectures and there are no study guides and minimal extra credit.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Overall, I think this was a pretty easy class. She gives out 2 extra credit assignments at the beginning of the year and that's it, don't bother asking for anything later in the year. The quizzes aren't hard and are like 5 questions max, and we had about 7 discussions posts where you can easily get 120% if you post by the initial deadline.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: I had Dr. Holdzkom for online US History but she was very nice and made the class very interesting. While there are a lot of lecture videos to watch, she makes them interesting. History has never been my favorite subject but I really enjoyed this class. There are group discussions but they are easy. Tests are only hard if you don't take notes.
rating_tags: Group projects--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: Her online vs in person must be 2 different types of people because as far as I'm concerned, I did not like this course or her. I don't like history either unless its actually interesting and it wasn't. The milestone document readings were either way too long or they were easy reads. tough with grades & there's basically no ec. Shes very strict too
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read

comment: Doesn't provide any study resources at all for tests and they are not easy. Memorize the timelines or you haven't a chance of passing. Helpful and responds quickly to emails, will go out of her way to help with course issues. Lectures are not terrible but no supplementary resources or even transcripts are provided, so your notes are all you've got.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Clear grading criteria

comment: CANNOT HYPE UP DOCTOR HOLDZKOM ENOUGH!!! She is amazing. Her class is not hard; just read the readings and SHOW UP TO CLASS. She explains the material in a narrative format, which is extremely helpful. 5 reading quizzes (not hard at all), 2 exams, and one research paper. Don't save the paper for the end; work on it as soon as it's assigned.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Caring--Respected

comment: This Professor was so enjoyable to listen to, I don't like history but she was honestly super interesting to listen to, because you can tell she really enjoys history. Her quizzes are easy as long as you read, her group discussions and paper are SUPER easy. Her test a bit more challenging, make sure to take good notes and listen.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: Holdzkom was extremely passionate about her class, and though her grading was a little harsh it was usually pretty fair. She always explained why she took points off it wasn't random. Strict on citations, but that comes with the major. Big written exams -- based off readings and lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Amazing lectures --Graded by few things

comment: Good class, she always gives us reminders and tips throughout the course. 3 lockdown browser tests, 6 quizzes, 3 EASY one-page essays, and 6 group discussion boards. Everything you need to know is in the lectures/videos/links. Study those and you will be fine. The workload is relatively light for college, but there's a lot to memorize.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lots of homework--Lecture heavy

comment:
Definitely take professor Holdzkom! She's nice, knowledgeable and always available if you need help with anything. 

She's also pretty lenient on grading.

You can tell that she loves history. Her lectures are full of information. Unfortunately, obscure information is what ends up on exams. Papers are easy but long, one-page, single-spaced. Quizzes are based on historical documents, so you have to be able to understand those.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Caring--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Holdkom is very knowledgeable, five quizzes and two tests. All written response but shes a fair grader. One term paper that is time consuming but overal not bad. Like i said she's a fair grader and the class is not hard as long as you pay attention. She is a fair attendance policy. 3 absences/freebies. 10/10. One of my favorite professors.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: Not the teacher for me!  The teaching style, forced group discussion posts (where you rely on others for your grade...), and no true academia behind the course I paid for.  It's incredibly disappointing that I am learning hardly anything in this class.  Tests restricted to ONE DAY ONLY and I'm an online student which is supposed to be SELF PACED
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Lots of homework

comment: I took Dr. Holdzkom for my research seminar. Dr. Holdzkom is a wonderful and caring professor. She was incredibly helpful and encouraging throughout the semester, and I would recommend her to anyone. The research seminar consisted of four grades: Two mandatory meetings, the rough draft, and the final paper. Dr. Holdzkom gives detailed feedback.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: You can tell she really cares about what she is teaching. She tells the truth about history and doesn't make it about only learning dates. Quizzes are easy 100s but tests are over lectures so if you do not listen and take notes, you will not do well. Textbook is cheap and interesting. She keeps lectures fun and actually makes history enjoyable.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: I never liked history so I had to put in the effort, but she made the class enjoyable! Get ready to read, debate, exams, and quizzes! She's willing to help you in any way possible!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Don't take her online if you don't like reading, writing, and discussion posts. There are quizzes on the assigned reading in most of the weeks, 3 writing papers along with the group and individual discussion posts. NO ANY EXTRA POINTS. 3 exams are hard, include multiple-choice questions, match, and filling-in blank. Tough grader, not very caring.
rating_tags: Tough grader

comment: Amazing prof! Cares about her students! Very passionate about history and teaches like it is a story, very easy to listen and understand!! I will be taking her again! There are weekly quizzes that are easy to get over 100% on, but tests you need to go to class and take notes, or else you won't do good. Easy A! Take her!
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I don't like history generally, and i enjoyed this class. She does a great job at making lectures seem interesting, and is genuinely passionate for the subject.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I LOVED Dr. Holdzkom's class! She's a great choice for history majors and haters. She presents history as if you're living in the moment, like storytelling. Only Two Tests (Mainly on Lectures), Seven Quizzes (Over Primary Sources, Lowest Dropped) and the Final. Take her if you have the chance!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Holdzkom conveys history from a place of "why did these people do what they did"? Short story: this won't be your usual "remember the dates and names" type of class. Her background in drama makes for immersive, captivating lectures that oftentimes make you wish class lasted more than 50 minutes. She will make you fall in love with US history.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr Holdzkom was amazing!! I typically hate history but she made it so enjoyable. There's a quiz most fridays over history documents which can be a difficult but she is always open to questions about them. Three tests including the final but if you take good notes and study you'll have no problem. One of the best history teachers by far!!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: She was very enthusiastic about what she was teaching and appreciated questions because she wanted us to understand the material as well as possible. There were seven quizzes throughout the semester, and 4 tests (one was the final- noncumulative) that, as long as you study, you do very well on.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy

comment: TAKE HER!! She loves history, makes her lectures more interesting. She wants you to care, if you participate she'll like it. Honors section had 3 debates, you only participate in 1 and help grade the rest. 4 quizzes, midterm and final. She'll post powerpoints, use them; tests are ESSAYS, so know *something* on the topic, use examples and get an A!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I don't even like history but she's a good teacher. She tells history lectures as if she was there in the moment. She is very knowledgeable on it also. All you have to do is complete the assingned readings, maybe even skim them, and listen well in class to pass.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: She was supportive and always made sure you thoroughly understood what she was teaching. She is super passionate about the class. Would definitely take again. Take this class!!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: She is a great teacher and knows a lot of information. 2 exams 50%, 1 final 30% and 7 quizzes 20%. Test questions come from notes so you need to take notes very well if you want an A in the class.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Lectures were very long and boring. The material was very difficult and if you miss class it is very hard to fully grasp what was talked about during lecture. 3 tests and all the combined quiz grades determine your grade and no extra credit opportunity.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I took her for US History in my freshman year. I reminisce on times when class was so simple, for example Dr. Holdzcom's class. She is a kind woman, and you can tell she has a true passion for history. She clearly explains all the material that will be on her tests. You have to read a lot, but if you study, this class should be a breeze!
rating_tags: Respected--Get ready to read--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Feedback was always clear and provided quickly. There was a lot of reading that is required to do well. Lectures were humourous and very interesting. Dr. Holdzkom is VERY enthusiastic about the course and makes the content clear. The final project/presentation was very entertaining. I would definitely suggest this class to anyone!

Really great professor. Attendance is mandatory but she rarely keeps students the whole time. Even when she does, her lectures are very too the point and not full of unneeded information. She really interacts with her students as well. She is very passionate. The readings made the difference between an A and a B student. Wears the cutest dresses :)

Professor Holdzkom is hands down the best history teacher I've ever had! History is definitely not my strong suit but I came out with a fairly easy A and a great experience. Her lectures are long, but she is very animated and really knows some cool stuff about American history. As long as you attend class and take notes you'll be fine! Take her!
Her lectures were great and easy to get into! If you read the text , the quizzes are a breeze. If you pay attention you'll be fine

Dr. Holdzkom took some time to grow on me. She is VERY enthusiastic and it took time for me to get use to it. Great class discussions and she genuinely was interested in the opinions and information that students had to contribute. No review for tests (2), five reading quizzes (better read), and attendance policy.

I HATE history, but she made it sooo easy! She describes history like a soap opera so its so easy to understand. She is a very nice lady that really does care for her students. I wish I had her for all of my other history classes. Quizzes about every other week, and three tests. Not bad. If you take notes, you'll pass. TAKE HER. YOU WONT REGRET IT!
Lectures are very good, discussion or quiz every week but readings are not difficult. Go to class and take notes, learn material and background then you'll be good.

Old school prof who knows her stuff and expects a lot of upper level students. Five short answer quizzes on readings, two exams with short answers and essay, plus term paper and class discussions on readings. Very nice prof, but won't put up with slack behavior - she'll call you out on it in class. Great class for highly motivated history students.

She is a pretty cool professor. She makes the subject somewhat interesting. The text book is necessary for quizzes. The tests and things aren't really complicated. Just take notes and beat the info into your brain. The MORE you beat, the BETTER your grade!

One of the best professors I've ever had! She explains everything in a way that you actually get interested in the subject and learn at the same time. Tests are not too easy or too hard. She makes it clear about what you have to do to make an A in class. I believe the key to success in her class is just showing up and taking good notes.

Dr. Holdzkom was an extremely good professor. Her class does requires effort to achieve a good grade. You have to study the material and take excellent notes. She covers the material very thoroughly. Meeting her outside of class is extremely easy and she will answer any question you may possibly have on anything. I definitely recommend her class.

Dr. Holdzkom is a wonderful teacher! I have had few like her. You can tell that she is extremely dedicated to her job and truly enjoys the subjects she teaches. She is not monotone at all and makes learning a usually dry subject quite entertaining. If I have to take any more class I will definitely be choosing her!

I didn't fail this class because she knew I took notes every lecture and I was engage in the class and asks questions. Reading the text is required to pass weekly quizzes.  The reading took 2 full hours approx. for me each week, including the footnotes and summaries in each chapter.  Do all this and you will get a passing grade.

She is an alright teacher, but her help outside of the class is little to none. She is very blunt and is very hypocritical when it comes to questions. She will repeat 3-4x if anyone has questions, but when someone does, she will either be rude about it or use you as an example for later class. She cuts no slack and her personality is monotonous.3/5

Awesome teacher. My favorite at SPSU, and with history being one of my least favorite classes, she has made it fun and entertaining while the class is moderately easy, as long as you go to class and pay attention and take notes, you'll get an A and will enjoy the lectures. Overall I definitely recommend her.

Take her for history. She seems to come off as a little bit too passionate, but it is way better than a mundane and monotone professor lecturing you. If you read the textbook and take good notes and review them you will get an A no problem. She is very willing to help too, very nice and good professor.

She has to be the greatest history professor at SPSU. I enjoyed class every day and without question would take her again. You have to take a lot of notes but what did you expect for history. I learned more history than I ever had before. Two tests, reading quizzes, and a final. Tests and final are so easy. Definitely recommend her!!!
Amazing professor. Definately take her is you can. You will have to take notes but what do you expect? As long as you show up and take notes you will do well.
Just awesome! Take her if you can!

Amazing professor! Helps to attend class everyday, and don't leave after a quiz because she will give pop quizzes after you go that will be worth points on tests. Only 2 tests and a final when it comes to major grades so be sure to take good notes.
She is a great teacher and very knowledgeable.  She bends over backwards to help students in her class.

Awesome professor.  You will take tons of notes and will need to study (unless you memorize stuff easily) for her exams & tests but they are reasonable.  She's very clear with expectations and deadlines.  Past history classes have been painful but I actually look forward to her class.  She is passionate about the subject and it shows.

She is the best history teacher ever! Her class isn't hard but it's not the easiest in the world. If you simply go to class and take pretty good notes you get an A. Try to do some of the readings and you'll do fantastic. If you ask her a question or 2 a class you will become her favorite student. She really loves history.

Dr. Holdzkolm was the very best professor that any student could ask for. She was always pleasant and down to earth when it came to her class and the students getting all that they needed to be knowledgeable about history. She is a refreshing tribute to what is missing from the world of teaching. She was and still is the absolute best. Amazing!

This is one of the best teachers I've ever had. I learned so much. She does not use a traditional textbook, so you must attend class lectures and take lots of notes.  Tests are limited and there is no padding of grade with attendance or extra credit, so be prepared to do well on each test.

Dr. Holdzkom is the best history professor I've had.  Take good notes (I used OneNote), and highlight your book.  Work hard in her class and you will earn an A.  She makes history enjoyable with here story telling teaching technique.

Dr. Holdzkom is amazing. She taught me new ways to look at things and she is really on top of her game. You can stop in and see her at anytime and she always makes herself readily available. I think she is great and if you do what you are supposed to, you'll receive the grade you worked for. She's the best and gives great advice too.

I had American History.  Great teacher, taking her again soon.  Take the notes in class and do the assigned readings and you are GOLDEN. You will learn a lot in her class and she makes history interesting by giving great insight.  I was able to attend one of two class times. Once she overlapped a bit and her lecture was IDENTICAL! She knows her shi

She is GOOD, Take notes = pass class,  Pay attention =  pass class, read sections = pass class. This was an easy class if you apply yourself, you will love her and really funny and keeps your interested in the lecture periods
Great teacher and a good sense of humor.
Great teacher.  I would take another class with her if I could.
Great. Taking her again for World.

DO NOT buy the text book. It is useless she covers everything you need to know in the notes. You must buy the reading book because there are very simple quizzes on it. Take good notes, study an hour before the test and you will get an A.  Best teacher i've had a poly so far.

A very nice, helpful professor, she made this an interesting class even though this was her first time teaching it. It’s obvious she did her best to prepare for class and was able to present the material to us in an interesting, easy to understand way. Expect this already good class to improve further as Dr Holdzkom gains fluency with the material.

THIS TEACHER IS AWESOME!  Very informative, smart, and EXTREMELY helpful!!   Go to class, take notes, study the notes, and you'll do just fine!  Has reading quizzes every 3 - 4 weeks, but they arent too bad.  I would recommend her to ANYONE!!
Easy teacher.  Takes notes and study! very helpful!!!
She is the best teacher i have ever had. She is very sweet and keeps you listening!
She is a very good teacher. Just take lots of good notes and you will do fine. Tests aren't that hard if you know your stuff. Highly recomend.
Prof. Holdzkom wrote her own book and knows her stuff.  She sparked an interest that wasn't there before.  I would strongly recommend her.  She's clear, energetic, fair, and amazingly smart!
Good teacher.  tons of notes, but if you take good ones, you should do well on the tests.  The multiple choice questions are extremely easy.
No Comments

Was a pretty good class.  I hated the ID's and Essay's on her tests; you have to be extremely specific to get all of the credit, it's hard to know exactly what she is looking for.  This is a good class though, she is energetic which makes this alot easier.
Very good professor. Very clear in what she wants. Sparked my interest in history. Lots of notes but they pay off in the end. Very energetic which helps when you are in an hour and 15 min class.
Made me interested in the subject. Taking all those notes were tough, but it was worth it! (A) Makes things fit together, not just names and dates. Not bad on the eyes either! :)
No Comments
pretty nice, patient and helpful. take her classes!
Awesome
